intro: Epidendrum lawessonii, commonly known as the Orange-Flowered Epidendrum, is a tropical orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its striking orange and yellow flowers, which bloom in clusters along the stems. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are usually broad and革质 (leathery), providing structural support and aiding in water retention. Epidendrum lawessonii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in greenhouses or as a houseplant.
